intro: Bryodesma acanthonota, commonly known as the rough-horned grasshopper plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Bryodesma acanthonota is known for its resilience to dry conditions and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions.
